description: From Latin, from Ancient Greek πρό (pró, “before”) + φύλαξις (phúlaxis, “a watching, guarding”).

adjectives.description: prophylactic (comparative more prophylactic, superlative most prophylactic)

entries.meaning: Serving to prevent or protect against an undesired effect, especially disease or pregnancy

definitionGroups.group: A medicine which preserves or defends against disease; a preventive.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Any device or mechanism intended to prevent harmful consequences.
examples: The securities laws are a prophylactic against stock fraud.
